alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Claiborne; Grainger; Hancock; Knox; Morgan; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:36PM CST until February 17 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Anderson County in east Tennessee... Southern Campbell County in east Tennessee... Claiborne County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Grainger County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Hancock County in east Tennessee... North Central Knox County in east Tennessee... East Central Morgan County in east Tennessee... Union County in east Tennessee... * Until 230 AM EST. * At 1136 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oak Ridge, Clinton, La Follette, Maynardville, Oliver Springs, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Plainview, Harrogate, Caryville, Rocky Top, Norris, Luttrell, Norris Lake, Big Ridge State Park, Paulette, Sharps Chapel, Fincastle, Andersonville and Norris Dam State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Campbell; Claiborne; Grainger; Hancock; Knox; Morgan; Union
